## Overview

This reference architecture provides patterns for building secure, maintainable REST API backends that align with DGOV DTT standards.

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-cap: "OpenAPI Backend Reference Architecture"
flowchart TD
    A[Client Applications] --> B[Load Balancer/CDN]
    B --> C[API Gateway]
    C --> D[Authentication Service]
    C --> E[Business Logic APIs]
    E --> F[Database Layer]
    E --> G[External Services]
    
    H[Monitoring & Logging] --> C
    H --> D
    H --> E
    H --> F
    
    I[CI/CD Pipeline] --> E
    I --> D
```

## Required New ADRs (Backlog)

### High Priority

- **Database Patterns** - ORM standards, connection pooling, migration strategies
- **Authentication Architecture** - JWT vs OAuth2 vs OIDC implementation patterns  
- **Error Handling Standards** - Consistent error responses, logging patterns

### Medium Priority

- **Performance Patterns** - Caching strategies, rate limiting, pagination
- **Service Communication** - Inter-service patterns, circuit breakers, timeouts
- **Testing Strategies** - Unit, integration, contract testing standards

### Low Priority

- **API Versioning** - Breaking change management, deprecation policies
- **Documentation Automation** - Auto-generated docs, examples, SDK generation
- **Deployment Patterns** - Blue-green, canary, rolling deployment strategies
